meanings.definition: To separate or disconnect the joints of something.
meanings.sent1: She was unjointing the puzzle pieces to put them back in the box.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was unjointing the old engine to replace it with a new one.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried unjointing its arms to do a dance, but ended up in a funny pose.
meanings.sent4: The magician unjointed the rings, making them appear to pass through each other.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter's precision in unjointing the wood made the furniture sturdy and beautiful.

meanings.definition: The act of disassembling or taking apart joints.
meanings.sent1: The unjointing of the toy robot revealed its intricate inner mechanisms.
meanings.sent2: The unjointing of the old chair exposed the worn-out joints that needed repair.
meanings.sent3: The unjointing of the Lego structure left a pile of colorful bricks on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The unjointing of the ancient artifact revealed hidden inscriptions on the joints.
meanings.sent5: The unjointing of the model airplane allowed for a closer look at its detailed construction.
